item.title: Definition of 'Security Policy'
item.description: Book: Computer Security, Art and Science, By Matt Bishop, 2nd edition. A security policy defines “secure” for a system or a set of systems. A security policy is a statement that partitions the states of the system into a set of authorized, or secure, states and a set of unauthorized, or nonsecure, states.
